alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Otero Mesa; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 8:13PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Otero and east central Dona Ana Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 812 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of White Sands National Monument, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, blowing dust with visibility reductions down to 2 miles, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orogrande, Alamogordo, White Sands National Monument, Boles Acres and The Otero Mesa. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 174 and 196. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 15 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Otero Mesa; Southern Tularosa Basin
